intro: Adonis micrantha, commonly known as the small-flowered adonis, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia. It is a member of the Ranunculaceae family, which includes buttercups and other similar plants. The plant produces showy, yellow or orange flowers that bloom in early spring. Its leaves are palmately divided, with a delicate, fern-like appearance. Adonis micrantha is often found in alpine and subalpine habitats, thriving in well-drained soils and cool climates.
